page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: SLENNINGFORD WATERMILL IS 1 MILE FROM WEST TANFIELD ALONG THE RIPON ROAD,ON THE BANKS OF THE RIVER URE. IN A SMALL BUILDING JOINING THE MILL IS AN OLD RUSTY UNDERSHOT WATERMILL WHICH HAS NOT WORKED SINCE 1950 AND HAS FALLEN INTO DISREPAIR.NEARBY ARE THE SLUICE GATES WHICH ARE BROKEN AND THE MILL RACE IS FULL OF MUD AND WOULD NEED DREDGING IF THE MILL WAS TO WORK AGAIN. INSIDE THE DUSTY MILL,ONE CAN SEE PIECES OF MACHINERY WHICH WERE USED WHEN THE MILL WAS OPERATING.THERE ARE THE LARGE GRINDING STONES WHICH WERE POWERED BY THE WATER WHEEL.THERE ARE SHOOTS FOR DELIVERING THE CORN (WHEAT, BARLEY,OATS).ABOVE THE GRINDING STONES ARE THE APPLE TOOTHED COGS AND THE SACK HOIST,WHICH TOOK THE BAGS OF CORN TO THE TOP OF THE BUILDING.THE MILL ITSELF HAS 3 FLOORS.
